lines.text: Doesn't my body drive you wild with desire?
I'm going to be a great film star! That is, if booze and sex don't get me first.
What is it darling?
GOD DAMN IT, I'M GOING TO HAVE A BABY!

[singing]
Life is a cabaret ol' chum so come to the Cabaret.
[on the pronunciation of "phlegm"]
P H is always pronounced as F, and, uh, you don't sound the G.
Then why are they putting the G, please?
That's, that's a very good question, but rather difficult to explain.
Try, Brian.
Well, uh, it's just there.
So, Mr. Professor, you do not know?
No.
Then I am sorry. I cannot help you.
Screw Maximilian!
I do.
So do I.
You two bastards!
Two? Two? Shouldn't that be three?
[describing a telegram from her father]
"Gee, kid, tough. Sincerely hope nose doesn't fall off. Love."
Outside it is windy, but inside it is so hot, every night we have ze battle to keep the girls from taking off all their clothing. So don't go away, who knows? Tonight we may lose the battle!
In here, life is beautiful. The girls are beautiful. Even the orchestra is beautiful!
[Curtains pull back to reveal an all-girl band]
You're American.
Oh God, how depressing! You're meant to think I'm an international woman of mystery. I'm working on it like mad.
I suppose you're wondering what I'm doing, working at a place like the Kit Kat Club.
Well, it is a rather unusual place.
That's me, darling. Unusual places, unusual love affairs. I am a most strange and extraordinary person.
Do you know what she has done to me? It's terrible! She has turned me into an honest man.
I saw a film the other day about syphilis. Ugh! It was too awful. I couldn't let a man touch me for a week. Is it true you can get it from kissing?
Oh, yes. And your king, Henry VIII, got it from Cardinal Wolsey whispering in his ear.
That is not, I believe, founded in fact. But from kissing, most decidedly; and from towels, and from cups.
And of course screwing.
Screw-ing, please?
Oh, uh...
[thinking]
fornication.
For-ni-ca-tion?
Oh, uh, Bri, darling, what is the German word?
I don't remember.

[thinking]
Oh... um... oh yes!
Oh, no...
Bumsen!

[appalled]
Oh.
That would be the one German word you pronounce perfectly.
Well, I ought to. I spent the entire afternoon bumsening like mad with this ghastly old producer who promised to get me a contract.
[pause]
Gin, Miss Landauer?
I am sorry to bother you, but I could not tell no one else. I do not know no other woman who gives her body so frequently... Oh! I am sorry, my English. Have I offended you?
Oh, no, not at all.
Well obviously those three girls were just...

[both laughing]
... the wrong three girls.
Divine decadence darling!
Aren't you ever gonna stop deluding yourself, hmm? Handling Max? Behaving like some ludicrous little underage femme fatale? You're... you're about as fatale as an after dinner mint!
The only thing you can do with virgins like that is pounce!
Bri, listen... we're practically living together, so if you only like boys I wouldn't dream of pestering you.
[pause]
Well, do you sleep with girls or don't you?
Sally! You don't ask questions like that!
I do.
Sally is rather knowledgeable in these areas.
You do what Sally says, you end up I think in prison.

[singing]
Wilkommen, bienvenue, welcome, im cabaret, au cabaret, to cabaret!
So, you took on the whole Nazi party?
[Brian holds up three fingers]

Of course, I may bring a boyfriend home occasionally, but only occasionally, because I do think that one ought to go to the man's room if one can. I mean, it doesn't look so much as if one expected it, does it?
Don't be so British!
Leave your troubles outside! Life is disappointing? Forget it!
"You will meet a strange man." Which under the circumstances is a pretty safe bet.
How's the, uh, gigolo campaign going?
Terrible. This week, already I'm giving up three dinner invitations to spend thirty-two marks on her.
That's quite a sacrifice.
I like it. God damn it!
What?
I think I'm falling in love with her.
Oh, I'm so sorry.
So am I.
My God! It's enough to drive a girl into a convent! Do they have Jewish nuns?
You did it, didn't you?
Did what, darling?
The abortion. In God's name, why?
One of my whims?

[singing]
Oh, Fatherland. Fatherland / Show us the sign / Your children have waited to see / The morning will come when the world is mine / Tomorrow belongs, tomorrow belongs, tomorrow belongs to me!

[after trying a prairie oyster for the first time]
Peppermint prairie oysters?
Oh, you got the toothpaste glass!
[laughs a little]
Does it really matter so long as you're having fun?
Have you got a cigarette? I'm desperate!
